H0.text: North is the direction that should face the windows added to the walls of a plant‑growing room in a northern state, allowing enough light to enter for healthy plant growth.

H1.text: South is the direction that windows should face to best solve the problem of insufficient light for healthy plant growth in a room used for growing plants in a northern state.

H2.text: East is the direction to which windows should be added on the walls of a plant‑growing room in a northern state to allow enough light for healthy plant growth.

H3.text: West is the direction in which windows should be added to a northern state plant‑growing room to allow enough light for healthy plant growth.

A5.text: A vertical window facing south (equator side) is effective for capturing solar thermal energy.

A6.text: In the Northern Hemisphere, the winter sun... is on the south (equator) side of the house all day long.
